item.title: 我们不能坐视不理加拿大总理提出针对特朗普的报复方案
item.description: 如果美国当选总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）兑现对美国从其北方邻国进口的所有商品征收25%关税的威胁，加拿大各省省长正在帮助制定一份可能的报复措施清单。【原文：Canada’s provincial premiers are helping to assemble a list of possible retaliatory measures if President-elect Donald Trump follows through on a threat to apply 25% tariffs against all goods the US imports from its northern neighbor.】

item.title: 印度初创企业 Rebel Foods 在计划上市前筹集资金
item.description: Rebel Foods 是一家专营在线餐厅的初创公司，在该公司寻求于 2026 年进行首次公开募股之前，它公布了一轮 2.1 亿美元的融资。【原文：Rebel Foods, a startup that specializes in online-only restaurants, unveiled a $210 million funding round, ahead of an initial public offering the company is seeking to pull off by 2026.】

item.title: 澳大利亚就业岗位持续增加，失业率意外下降
item.description: 澳大利亚 11 月份的失业率意外下降，该国的连续招聘增长得以延续，这凸显了劳动力市场对高利率的抵御能力，并促使交易商减少了对 2 月份降息的押注。【原文：Australia’s unemployment rate unexpectedly fell in November as the nation’s streak of hiring gains extended, underscoring the resilience of the labor market to elevated interest rates and prompting traders to pare back bets of a February interest-rate cut.】

item.title: 美国数据巩固降息前景，黄金连续四日攀升
item.description: 在一份关键的美国通胀报告支持了美联储在下周召开决策者会议时再次降息的预期之后，黄金保持了连续四天的上涨势头。【原文：Gold held a four-day advance after a key US inflation report supported expectations for another interest rate cut by the Federal Reserve when policymakers meet next week.】

item.title: 被害的 UnitedHealth 高管是 "好人 "之一，首席执行官如是说
item.description: 联合健康集团（UnitedHealth Group Inc.首席执行官安德鲁-威蒂（Andrew Witty）在周三给员工的一份说明中称遇害同事布莱恩-汤普森（Brian Thompson）为 "好人"，他试图在网上的仇恨洪流中安抚员工。【原文：UnitedHealth Group Inc. Chief Executive Officer Andrew Witty called slain colleague Brian Thompson “one of the good guys” in a note to employees Wednesday, as he sought to reassure them amid a torrent of online hate.】

item.title: 英国房价指标创两年多来新高
item.description: 由于英国央行降息以及工党首份预算案的不确定性结束，购房者受到提振，11 月份英国房价创下两年多来的新高。【原文：A closely watched gauge of UK house prices hit its highest in over two years in November as buyers were buoyed by a Bank of England interest-rate cut and an end to uncertainty over Labour’s first budget.】

item.title: 西拉公司宣布莫桑比克石墨矿不可抗力
item.description: 由于莫桑比克持续的内乱，澳大利亚矿商西拉资源有限公司（Syrah Resources Ltd.）已宣布其位于莫桑比克的巴拉马石墨矿不可抗力，并拖欠美国政府支持的贷款。【原文：Australian miner Syrah Resources Ltd. has declared force majeure for its Balama graphite mine in Mozambique due to ongoing civil unrest, and has defaulted on US government-backed loans.】

item.title: 预测特朗普 "抢跑"，温哥华投票 "抢先 "比特币
item.description: 温哥华通过了一项可能导致其在城市财政中使用比特币的政策；部分原因是美国当选总统唐纳德-特朗普的回归。【原文：Vancouver adopted a policy that could lead to it using Bitcoin in city finances — prompted in part by the return of US President-elect Donald Trump.】

item.title: 美国发出进一步制裁俄罗斯信号，石油保持涨势
item.description: 由于美国表示市场疲软可能会允许对俄罗斯能源行业实施进一步制裁，石油保持了上涨势头。【原文：Oil held an advance as the US indicated that a softer market may allow for further sanctions on Russia’s energy sector.】

item.title: 参议院小组推迟对克伦肖的投票，增加了参议院全票通过证交会的可能性
item.description: 民主党人卡罗琳-克伦肖（Caroline Crenshaw）被提名连任美国证券交易委员会（Securities and Exchange Commission）委员一职的计划投票被推迟后遇到了更多障碍。【原文：Democrat Caroline Crenshaw’s nomination to serve another term as a commissioner at the Securities and Exchange Commission just hit more obstacles after a planned committee vote was postponed.】

item.title: 新加坡豪宅交易日趋隐秘
item.description: 新加坡的超级富豪们在这个城市国家购买豪宅的行为越来越隐秘，以避免引起人们对其财富和社会地位的关注。【原文：Singapore’s ultra-rich are increasingly cloaking their purchases of mansions in the city-state in secrecy, to avoid drawing attention to their wealth and social status.】

item.title: 巴西 "大干一场"，巨幅加息将提振受挫货币
item.description: 巴西央行发出的鹰派信息有望提振雷亚尔，因为政策制定者们正努力抑制通胀预期，并在市场崩溃后恢复投资者信心。【原文：A hawkish message from Brazil’s central bank is expected to lift the real as policymakers seek to tame inflation expectations and restore investor confidence following a market rout.】

item.title: 美国通胀支持美联储减息，亚洲股市将上涨：市场综述
item.description: 周四，美国股市结束了连续两日的下滑态势，良性通胀数据支持了本月降息的预期，亚洲股市有望攀升。【原文：Asian stocks were poised to climb Thursday after US equities snapped a two-day slide on benign inflation data that supported expectations for an interest rate cut this month.】

item.title: 澳大利亚央行称澳大利亚支付利益相关方缺乏 "共同愿景
item.description: 澳大利亚储备银行的一位官员表示，澳大利亚银行、支付服务提供商和其他利益相关方尚未就账户到账户支付的理想功能达成共识，因为它们正在从现有的基础设施过渡。【原文：Australian banks, payment service providers and other stakeholders have yet to arrive at a shared vision of the desired features of account-to-account payments as they transition away from existing infrastructure, a Reserve Bank official said.】

item.title: 特朗普重返华盛顿，影响市场的数据面临威胁
item.description:
编制重要经济数据的美国机构在预算缩减的情况下举步维艰。【原文：

US agencies that produce vital economic data are struggling in the face of shrinking budgets.

】

item.title: 受预算限制影响的美国经济调查如下
item.description: 数十年来，美国统计机构一直资金不足，导致数据质量和数量都受到威胁。【原文：US statistical agencies have been underfunded for decades, which is putting both the quality and quantity of data produced at risk.】

item.title: 中国央行推出巨额降息措施，但暗示进一步宽松政策尚不确定
item.description: 在将利率从二十年来的最高水平迅速下调之后，加拿大央行正转向更为渐进的调整步伐，以抑制急于降低借贷成本的预期。【原文：After quickly chopping interest rates down from the highest levels in two decades, the Bank of Canada is pivoting to a more gradual pace of adjustments — pushing back on expectations of a rush to cheaper borrowing costs.】

item.title: 巴西央行承诺三月前将利率上调至 14.25
item.description: 巴西央行将基准利率上调了整整一个百分点，并承诺在接下来的两次会议上将进行两次同样幅度的加息，以急于恢复投资者信心和抑制通胀预期。【原文：Brazil’s central bank increased the benchmark interest rate by a full percentage point and promised to deliver two hikes of the same size in the next two meetings as it rushes to recover investor confidence and tame inflation expectations.】

item.title: 澳大利亚央行警惕特朗普关税带来的通胀风险
item.description: 早上好，我是乔治，这里是阳光明媚的悉尼，为您带来今早的头条新闻。今日必读：- 澳洲股市涨势将延续至明年- 澳洲央行将准备好对特朗普关税做出反应- 必和必拓、里约面临骚扰集体诉讼【原文：Good morning, it’s Georgie here in sunny Sydney, with this morning’s top news... Today’s must-reads:• Australian stock rally to extend into next year• RBA will be ready to react on Trump tariffs• BHP, Rio face harassment class actions】

item.title: 微软因持有通用汽车 Cruise 股份而需支付 8 亿美元费用
item.description: 在通用汽车公司（General Motors Co. ）表示将关闭其自动驾驶出租车计划后，微软公司（Microsoft Corp.【原文：Microsoft Corp. plans to take an $800 million charge after General Motors Co. said it was shutting down its autonomous taxi initiative.】

item.title: Adobe 前景令人失望，引发人工智能颠覆担忧
item.description: Adobe 公司发布了令人失望的年度销售展望，凸显了人们对这家创意软件巨头可能被新兴人工智能初创公司颠覆的担忧。【原文：Adobe Inc. gave a disappointing annual sales outlook, underscoring anxieties that the creative software giant could be disrupted by emerging artificial intelligence-based startups.】

item.title: 尽管存在贸易风险，新西兰初级产品出口仍将复苏
item.description: 在截至 2024 年 6 月的一年中，中国的需求疲软抑制了乳制品和木材等商品的价格，预计新西兰的初级产品出口将从大幅下降中反弹。【原文：New Zealand’s primary exports are projected to rebound from a sharp decline in the year through June 2024, when softer demand in China depressed prices for commodities like dairy and lumber.】

item.title: 摇滚明星 "大卫-邦德曼受到行业领袖的悼念
item.description: 大卫-邦德曼（David Bonderman）曾对他的前老板说，他对投资一无所知。在他生命的最后时刻，他被认为是私募股权投资界的传奇人物，并指导他的公司 TPG Inc.【原文：David Bonderman once told his former boss that he didn’t know anything about investing. By the end of his life, he was considered a legend in the private equity world and had directed his firm, TPG Inc., in doling out billions of dollars to turn around companies.】

item.title: 微策略公司玩转比特币引发纳斯达克 100 指数纳入问题
item.description: 迈克尔-赛勒（Michael Saylor）的微策略公司（MicroStrategy Inc.【原文：Michael Saylor’s MicroStrategy Inc. checks all the boxes for inclusion in the Nasdaq 100 Index, a development that would trigger purchases of the shares by the $451 billion worth of exchange-traded funds around the world that directly track the benchmark.】

item.title: 寻求避险者和财政支出助推澳大利亚股市上涨势头
item.description: 随着更多政策支持迹象的出现，以及投资者寻找基本不受地缘政治紧张局势影响的市场，澳大利亚股票破纪录的涨势有望延续。【原文：Australia’s record-breaking stock rally is poised to extend as signs of more policy support emerge and investors look for markets largely shielded from geopolitical tensions.】

item.title: 斯塔达在 15 亿多欧元首次公开募股前向投资者征求意见
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，Stada Arzneimittel AG 公司正在为其首次公开募股寻找投资者，有可能为这家以消费者健康为重点的制药商筹集到约 15 亿欧元（16 亿美元）的新资金。【原文：Stada Arzneimittel AG is sounding out investors for its initial public offering that could potentially raise around €1.5 billion ($1.6 billion) of fresh capital for the consumer health-focused drugmaker, people familiar with the matter said.】

item.title: ServiceNow 重组 RiseUp 劳动力培训计划并裁员
item.description: 服务诺公司（ServiceNow Inc. ）正在重组其用户培训项目 RiseUp，因为就业率很低，而且企业对以多元化为重点的计划也很反感。【原文：ServiceNow Inc. is restructuring its user training program RiseUp amid low job placement rates and a corporate backlash to diversity-focused initiatives.】

item.title: Blackstone 希望在决议交易后加强与日本的关系
item.description: Blackstone Inc. 表示，在日本公司以 82 亿美元收购 Resolution Life Group Holdings Ltd. 之后，该公司迫切希望加强与日本生命保险公司的关系。【原文：Blackstone Inc. signaled that it’s eager to strengthen its relationship with Nippon Life Insurance Co. following the Japanese firm’s $8.2 billion purchase of Resolution Life Group Holdings Ltd.】

item.title: 国债不再像以前那样随通胀数据波动
item.description: 29 万亿美元的国债市场对新公布的美国通胀数据的波动幅度已经变小，因为这些数据更加符合市场的一致预期。【原文：Swings in the $29 trillion Treasury market have gotten smaller in reaction to fresh US inflation data as the releases have become more aligned with consensus expectations.】

item.title: 阿尔伯森交易失败后，克罗格加入回购债务的行列
item.description: 克罗格公司（Kroger Co.）在试图收购阿尔伯森公司（Albertsons Cos.）被法官阻止后，成为可能被迫向投资者回购债务的最新一家公司。【原文：Kroger Co. has become the latest company that may be forced to buy back debt from investors after its attempt to purchase Albertsons Cos. was blocked by judges.】
